sense.gloss: to fly (a kite, etc.), to launch (fireworks, etc.), to surface (a submarine, etc.)
to enrol (one's child in school), to enroll
to increase (price, quality, status, etc.), to develop (talent, skill), to improve
to make (a loud sound), to raise (one's voice)
to give (an example, etc.), to cite
to summon up (all of one's energy, etc.)
to offer up (incense, a prayer, etc.) to the gods (or Buddha, etc.)
to conduct (a ceremony, esp. a wedding)
to do for (the sake of someone else)

sdata.j: ↑彼↑↓かれ↓が↑得点↑↓とくてん↓を|↑挙↑↓あ↓げる|と↑群集↑↓ぐんしゅう↓は↑大声↑↓おおごえ↓を↑上↑↓あ↓げた。
sdata.e: The crowd yelled when he scored a goal.

sdata.j: 「↑冬↑↓ふゆ↓のソナタ」を↑例↑↓れい↓に|↑挙↑↓あ↓げる|までもなく、いまや↑時↑↓とき↓ならぬ↑韓↑↓かん↓↑流↑↓りゅう↓ブームである。
sdata.e: You don't need to bring up "A Winter Sonata" to show that South Korean culture is having an unexpected boom in Japan.

sdata.j: ↑私↑↓わたし↓と↑結婚式↑↓けっこんしき↓を|↑挙↑↓あ↓げる|↑前↑↓まえ↓の↑晩↑↓ばん↓に、↑彼女↑↓かのじょ↓が↑私↑↓わたし↓の↑親友↑↓しんゆう↓と↑浮気↑↓うわき↓をしていました。
sdata.e: The night before we were to be married, she had an affair with my best friend.

sdata.j: 「ねえねえ、↑知↑↓し↓ってる？↑田中↑↓たなか↓↑先生↑↓せんせい↓って、↑結婚↑↓けっこん↓するんだって！」「まじで？いつ？」「↑来週↑↓らいしゅう↓、↑式↑↓しき↓、|↑挙↑↓あ↓げる|らしいよ」
sdata.e: Hey, did you know? Mr. Tanaka's getting married! "For real? When?" "I think they're holding the ceremony next week."

sdata.j: 「ねぇねぇ、↑聞↑↓き↓いて！↑田中↑↓たなか↓↑先生↑↓せんせい↓って、↑結婚↑↓けっこん↓するんだって！」「まじで？いつ？」「↑来週↑↓らいしゅう↓、↑式↑↓しき↓、|↑挙↑↓あ↓げる|らしいよ」
sdata.e: Hey, did you know? Mr. Tanaka is getting married! "Really?? When?" "I think the wedding is next week."

sdata.j: ↑私↑↓わたし↓は↑一↑↓いち↓↑ヶ月↑↓かげつ↓↑後↑↓ご↓に↑結婚式↑↓けっこんしき↓を|↑挙↑↓あ↓げる|。
sdata.e: I'm having a wedding in a month.
